summary: This is an FBI Electronic Communication documenting the receipt of illegible complaint mail from inmate Ronald D. Wolfguts on October 21, 2019. The mail, which was submitted to the zero file, contained legible portions indicating Wolfguts claimed to have intelligence about an unknown person and wrote about Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ronald D. Wolfguts
persons.context: Inmate who sent illegible complaint mail to the FBI Tucson Resident Agency, claiming to have intelligence about an unknown person and writing about Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the complaint mail sent by inmate Ronald D. Wolfguts.

connections.description: Wolfguts wrote about Epstein in his complaint mail to the FBI, claiming to have intelligence.

events.title: Receipt of Complaint Mail
events.description: FBI Duty Agent at the Tucson Resident Agency received illegible complaint mail from inmate Ronald D. Wolfguts.

events.title: FBI Electronic Communication Created
events.description: FBI documented the receipt of Wolfguts' complaint mail and its submission to the zero file due to being largely illegible.

keyFacts: Inmate Ronald D. Wolfguts sent complaint mail to the FBI on October 21, 2019, claiming to have intelligence about an unknown person and writing about Jeffrey Epstein.
The complaint mail was largely illegible and was therefore submitted to the zero file by the FBI.
The FBI documented this communication in an Electronic Communication on October 31, 2019.
The document indicates the FBI received but did not act on the information due to its illegible nature.
